title: 820-3476 green light but Dead
message: PPBUS_3GH 12.6v , all PP3v42 3.42v, smc_pm_g2_en is 3.4 but no power up from power but or power on pads

title: 820-3476 green light but Dead
message:
Do you get 3V3_S5/SUS voltages?
Post PM_BATLOW_L and be sure to use original Magsafe 2 60/85W charger.

title: 820-3476 green light but Dead
message:
3v3_s5 = 3.3v
3v3_sus = 3.3v
pm_batlow_L =3.3v
original MagSafe 2 65w

title: 820-3476 green light but Dead
message:
Now post PM_PWRBTN_L, PM_RSMRST_L and SMC_ONOFF_L.
Trigger SMC_ONOFF_L and check for drop pulse at PM_PWRBTN_L at same time.
If yes, check for pulse at PM_SLP_S4_L too.

title: 820-3476 green light but Dead
message:
Pm_rsmrst_L = 3.3v
smc_onoff_L =2.0v

im gonna solder a wire to smc_onoff_L  and see if I can simulate pwr button

title: 820-3476 green light but Dead
message: My mistake smc_onoff_L is 3.4v

title: 820-3476 green light but Dead
message: I simulated power button it does indeed drop to zero and back up to 3.4V

title: 820-3476 green light but Dead
message: I?m gonna investigate why pm_slp_s4_L from pch and work my way forward

title: 820-3476 green light but Dead
message: Ok I have pm_slp_s4_L but it doesn?t fluctuate when I ground the smc_onoff_L

title: 820-3476 green light but Dead
message:
Do you mean PM_SLP_S4_L is always high?
In such case, S3 voltages should be present too.
Post voltage at all big coils.
Also check ALL_SYS_PWRGD level.

title: 820-3476 green light but Dead
message:
Yes it stays high
pp3v3_s3 =3.3v
pp5v_s3 =5v
all_sys_pwrgd =3.3v

title: 820-3476 green light but Dead
message: C1950 is water damaged and cap is gone. Hiow important is c1950 it?s not grounded just missing end cap. Shouldn?t it power up without it? U 1950 doesn?t look damaged I checked all the resistors around u1950 they?re values are good

title: 820-3476 green light but Dead
message:
C1950 corroded, usually damage trace to pin 8/U1950 too.
In such case, rebuild the trace,
Remove U1950 and inspect all pads (board and chip).

Do you get VCORE?
Post voltage for pins 7 & 3 of U1950.

title: 820-3476 green light but Dead
message: I have 3.42v on all areas that should have this voltage present. but not on c1950 or trace coming from board. even at the point where it emerges from the board just let of u1950 I will back track to see where the issue is and diode mode on track is OL. So I?m guessing something got knocked off or open trace.

title: 820-3476 green light but Dead
message: Ok I removed the u1950 and found the trade gone on pp3v42 on pin 8 I re did the trace and cleaned up the u1950 8 pin but I?m thinking this thing might be no good. I?m order a new one.

title: 820-3476 green light but Dead
message: Quick question when I connect the fan it brings g3h down. How often does a bad fan bring down a power rail ? Anyway I ordered a new fan

title: 820-3476 green light but Dead
message:
Fan connects with 5V_S0.
If generates short there, SMC can detect and pulls down SMC_PM_G2_EN.

title: 820-3476 green light but Dead
message:
Hi ok so I actually repaired the fan connector and fan
touched up the u1950 and it turns on and boots fine. I never installed c1950. It didn?t seem important. But I figured I?d ask you. How crucial is c1950? Thanks for your response.

title: 820-3476 green light but Dead
message: Oh and lastly I have a few isl repairs I?d like to get 10k resistor and other things that commonly go around them would you be able to tell me what are the most common so I can purchase them ahead of time?

title: 820-3476 green light but Dead
message:
C1950 is not critical; you can forget it.

Buy resistor book kit, like here
[url]https://www.ebay.es/itm/0201-0402-0603-0805-1206-SMD-SMT-Capacitor-Chip-Resistor-Samples-Book-Kit-TZ5/192983430782?hash=item2ceeb5767e:m:mA4fZxxL757MJh-s2VVjdew[/url]
Don't throw money on capacitor kits, or mixed resistors/capacitors.
Buy ONLY resistors, from 0201 to 0805.
1206 is rarely used, but the price is low enough to have it in stock.

title: 820-3476 green light but Dead
message: Awesome thanks
